sponsor.partnerMessage: Live, laugh, pay nothing for attic insulation. See if you qualify for attic insulation and other energy-saving home improvements from SWEPCO’s Home Performance with ENERGY STAR® Pathway—all at no cost to you.

posts.title: Milken Institute Ranks NWA In Best Performing Cities Index
posts.content:
There continues to be a shift in economic success across the country, and it shows in the Milken Institute’s Best-Performing Cities Index. 

  • Doing well: The Milken Institute recently released its Best-Performing Cities report for 2022, and Northwest Arkansas is ranked as one of the nation’s top metros for economic resilience and opportunity. 
  • Tech work: The report places NWA as No. 8 in the US and relays that the influx of high-tech jobs in the region is a major factor in NWA's economic success. With companies such as Walmart, Tyson Foods, and J.B. Hunt expanding their online infrastructure, the amount of work in the tech field is bringing positive outcomes for the region’s economy.

See the full report HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Listed As Most Pet Friendly City In Arkansas
posts.content:
Thinking ahead to National Pet Day on April 11, Best Places created a map of the top pet-friendly cities in the United States, and Bentonville made the list! 

  • Methodology: The ‘Top Pet Friendly’ list is officially for those looking for road trip destinations with pet-friendly amenities such as dog parks, green spaces, hiking and walking trails, pet stores, veterinarians, and dog-friendly dining options. 
  • Placement: Local climate was also considered for the placement of cities on the list. Bentonville is just below the top 10 cities in the country out of the 50 total (one in every state) chosen for the Top Pet Friendly list. 

See the full list and rankings HERE.

posts.title: Explore Eden Offers Discount Code For NWA Daily Subscribers
posts.content:
Explore Eden is taking over the camping scene in NWA with new bookable properties being added to its platform every week! And for the next two weeks, NWA Daily subscribers get a discount. 

  • For any occasion: With springtime in full bloom, now is one of the best times to experience the outdoors. Private campsites booked through Explore Eden could be perfect for your next Easter celebration, kid's birthday party, company retreat, or simple nature get-away! 
  • Discount code: All NWA Daily subscribers can receive 15% off their next Explore Eden booking through April 19 by using the exclusive discount code "nwadaily" at checkout! 

Download the Explore Eden app HERE!

posts.title: A & M Railroad Plans April Special Events
posts.content:
Have you ever wanted to take a train ride like you see in the movies? The Arkansas & Missouri Railroad allows you to do just that from right here in Northwest Arkansas!

  • All aboard: The train has meticulously restored antique passenger cars, a first-class parlor car, and a 1940s Caboose called Lil’ Toot. Prices start at $46 and vary depending on the car you’re in and the destinations you choose. 
  • Hop on: The A & M Railroad’s latest special excursions are the following two Saturdays in April (April 9 & 16) and they’re calling them the “HIP-PITY HOP EGGSPRESS.” The trips are from Springdale to Van Buren and from Van Buren to Winslow. 

For more information about the train or to make reservations, click HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Bakery Makes Southern Living's 'Best Bakery' 2022 List
posts.content:
A Fayetteville favorite lunch and breakfast spot has made the list of southern “Bests” for 2022. 

  • Local shoutout: Southern Living recently released a list of The South’s Best Bakeries in 2022, and featured for NWA is none other than the Little Bread Company on Block Ave. in Fayetteville.
  • Makes sense: The Little Bread Company is known for its freshly baked goods, authentically homemade bread, and being a place of spunk and personality. Our favorite time to visit is on Saturday's after the Fayetteville Farmer's Market.

Learn more about Little Bread Company HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Listen in: Lone Social, a band from NWA released a new single on Friday.*
  • Winner winner: Congrats to "WPS" for winning the NWA Daily march madness bracket challenge.
  • Painting concrete: The City of Fayetteville has chosen two Artists for the retaining wall along Archibald Yell Boulevard.
  • Accommodations: Here's a comprehensive guide to campsites, lodges, and cabins in Arkansas State Parks.
  • Walking together: Rogers High is hosting a suicide prevention walk this Saturday.
  • Good journalism: Congrats to U of A students for winning Mark of Excellence journalism awards!
  • Need to promote an event? Check out our advertising deals to get in our newsletter!

*content is sponsored
